alert.note: Alert for Banner; Box Butte; Dawes; Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 7:17PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Box Butte, southeastern Scotts Bluff, Morrill, northeastern Banner and southeastern Dawes Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 617 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles south of Hay Springs to 7 miles south of Minatare. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Redington around 640 PM MDT. Court House And Jail Rocks and Bridgeport State Recreation Area around 650 PM MDT. The Intersection Of Highway 385 And 92 around 700 PM MDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include McGrew and Broadwater. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Banner; Box Butte; Dawes; Morrill; Scotts Bluff
